person.persName: Josiah Harris Jr (Louisville and Paducah attorney)

body.p: Born on November 14, 1839 in Columbia. Attorney. Native of Adair County. Attended Columbia College in Adair County and later attended college in Danville. Attended law school in Louisville in 1858. Passed the bar in 1860. Practiced in Louisville and then Paducah. Elected to office of prosecuting attorney of the city courts of Paducah in 1861. He was married in 1861, in Paducah, to Miss Cora Enders, who died in 1877, leaving a daughter, Miss Hallie Harris. June 5, 1882, he contracted a second marriage, this time to Miss Mattie Dunn, of Smithland, Ky.

bibl.p: J. H. Battle, W. H. Perrin, & G. C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State (Louisville:Battey Publishing, 1885).
